abstracts.cdata!:
The Riga District Heating Rehabilitation
            Project (RDHP) aimed to increase energy efficiency, and
            improve service levels of the heating system, through a
            Bank, and Swedish Loans to the Rigas Siltums Company, with
            the guarantee of the Republic of Latvia. However, the
            Ministry of Finance, subsequent to negotiations, questioned
            the condition in the Guarantee Agreement that required the
            Guarantor to cause the Energy Regulatory Board, to adjust
            heat tariffs on a regular basis, in order to allow the
            Borrower to recover appropriate costs, and remain
            competitive with other heating alternatives. Key concern was
            the uncertainty of disconnections from the District Heating
            (DH) system, in light of changes in the Energy Law, and
            removal of restrictions to install alternative heating
            systems, as well as concerns about the collateral to be
            provided by Rigas Siltums to back up the guarantee, and
            uncertainty over tariffs, and prices of alternative fuels.
            Given these risks, the Ministry of Finance could not issue a
            state guarantee, and, did not include the Project in the
            guarantee limit of the State Budget Law for 2001, nor for
            2002. Although the Bank is continuing specific energy market
            liberalization, and related gas and DH regulatory issues
            under a structural adjustment operation, the loans for RDHP
            have been withdrawn at the request of the Guarantor.
